content:
• Monday, March 12, 2012
  • EGY

    More on Vaalco Energy (NYSE:EGY): Q4 beats on revenue but comes up short on a per share basis....

    More on Vaalco Energy (NYSE:EGY): Q4 beats on revenue but comes up short on a per share basis. Revenue for the quarter was boosted by higher crude prices and higher sales volumes, but the gains were offet at the bottom line due to increased operating expenses associated with the higher sales volumes, substantially higher income taxes and a non-cash impairment charge on a domestic well in the Granite Wash formation. Shares -3.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:14 PM
  • SB

    Safe Bulkers (NYSE:SB) -8.1% AH after announcing a 5M share stock offering, good for proceeds of...

    Safe Bulkers (NYSE:SB) -8.1% AH after announcing a 5M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $35.8M based on today's close. The Greek dry bulk shipper plans to use the proceeds for vessel acquisitions, capex, and "general corporate purposes," which could include paying down debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP +13.6%) continues to be quite volatile following its IPO. Shares soared on their...

    Yelp (YELP +13.6%) continues to be quite volatile following its IPO. Shares soared on their first day of trading, tumbled over the next two, then tread water for 3 days before spiking higher again today in the absence of major news. Shares are currently up 50% from their $15 IPO price.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • GNC

    GNC (NYSE:GNC) says January and February same store sales increased by a percentage point to the...

    GNC (NYSE:GNC) says January and February same store sales increased by a percentage point to the mid-teens. This compares to an increase of approximately 6% for the first two months of fiscal 2011, and a 7.5% increase  reported for the first quarter of fiscal 2011. The company also reafirms guidance in line with Street estimates. Shares +2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • URBN

    More on Urban Outfitters' (NASDAQ:URBN) FQ4: Says rate of full-priced selling has improved Q/Q,...

    More on Urban Outfitters' (NASDAQ:URBN) FQ4: Says rate of full-priced selling has improved Q/Q, as it seeks to re-establish historical level. Comparable retail segment net sales up Y/Y at Urban Outfitters (+3%), Free People (+9%), and Anthropologie (+1%). Gross profit margin fell 640 bps versus last year. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • PULS-OLD

    Pulse Electronics (NYSEARCA:PULS-OLD): Q4 EPS of -$1.01 may not be comparable to consensus of...

    Pulse Electronics (NYSEARCA:PULS-OLD): Q4 EPS of -$1.01 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.01. Revenue of $90.5M (-10.6% Y/Y) misses by $1.5M. Shares -12.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • YOKU

    With a 36% share of the Chinese online video market, Youku.com (YOKU +27.4%) and Tudou (TUDO...

    With a 36% share of the Chinese online video market, Youku.com (YOKU +27.4%) and Tudou (TUDO +156.5%) will tower over #2 Sohu.com (NASDAQ:SOHU) and #3 Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) following their merger, notes Jiang Zhang. Moreover, the tie-up will help the combined company address rising bandwidth and content costs, and allow Youku to enter the Chinese mobile video market. Zhang speculates smaller players such as Ku6 (KUTV +11.9%) could now be acquisition targets for Sohu or Baidu.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • CCIX

    Coleman Cable (NASDAQ:CCIX): Q4 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $207M (+11.1% Y/Y)...

    Coleman Cable (NASDAQ:CCIX): Q4 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $207M (+11.1% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares -3.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • CKEC

    Carmike Cinemas (NASDAQ:CKEC): Q4 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $121M (+4.3% Y/Y)...

    Carmike Cinemas (NASDAQ:CKEC): Q4 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $121M (+4.3% Y/Y) beats by $8M. Shares +17.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q4 EPS of $0.27 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $731M (+9% Y/Y)...

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q4 EPS of $0.27 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $731M (+9% Y/Y) misses by $10M. Shares +3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • PBH

    Prestige Brands (PBH +2%) rejects Genomma Lab's $834M unsolicited bid to acquire the maker of...

    Prestige Brands (PBH +2%) rejects Genomma Lab's $834M unsolicited bid to acquire the maker of Comet and Spic n Span cleaners, calling it "inadequate." PBH adopts a shareholder rights plan in response to the bid, saying it would allow the board time and opportunity to consider any other that may be presented.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • ADTN

    Adtran (ADTN -2.5%) shares are cut to Neutral at MKM Partners, which says U.S. Tier 1...

    Adtran (ADTN -2.5%) shares are cut to Neutral at MKM Partners, which says U.S. Tier 1 service providers are accelerating capital equipment purchases from previous levels, but ADTN's core areas of wireline broadband access and HDSL backhaul equipment are not priorities. The firm says U.S. Tier 1s are more focused on wireless broadband access, IP/Ethernet and Optical.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • BBVA

    BBVA (BBVA -2%) remains one of Europe's best-run banks, but it faces charges from new...

    BBVA (BBVA -2%) remains one of Europe's best-run banks, but it faces charges from new regulations governing real estate exposure in Spain which accounted for 47% of 2011 profit, ING analysts say in cutting shares to Hold. But the firm raises rival Banco Santander (STD -1.7%), "one of the most profitable banks in the European Union despite its rocky Spanish exposure," to Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • IDIX

    Shares of Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +0.2%) make a beeline straight north - before settling...

    Shares of Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +0.2%) make a beeline straight north - before settling back down a bit - after chatter picks up that Merck (MRK +1.1%) might make a play to take over the company. It's not the first time a Merck-Idenix marriage has been bandied about, as Hepatitis C drug makers continue to stay in focus as a sector set for consolidation.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • BDSI

    BioDelivery Sciences International (BDSI -6.8%) falls after saying it will delay the relaunch of...

    BioDelivery Sciences International (BDSI -6.8%) falls after saying it will delay the relaunch of its Onsolis painkiller to modify the product amid questions from the FDA related to the product's appearance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • DYN

    Dynegy (DYN -28.2%) shares continue to slide as a U.S. trustee asks the judge overseeing the...

    Dynegy (DYN -28.2%) shares continue to slide as a U.S. trustee asks the judge overseeing the bankruptcy case of DYN’s holding company to appoint a trustee to manage the case. A court-appointed examiner alleged Friday that DYN fraudulently shuffled power-plant assets into separate units from those that filed for bankruptcy, an action he called "willful misconduct."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • REGN

    Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +2.8%) is added to Bank of America's "U.S. 1 List," calling the...

    Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +2.8%) is added to Bank of America's "U.S. 1 List," calling the company one of its top biotech picks for 2012. The firm says it sees upside to its above-consensus 2012 Eylea sales forecast of $350M, stemming from positive physician sentiment toward dosing frequency advantages for the eye treatment.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • KWK

    "Forget about $5 natural gas. When can we get back to $3," asks Raymond James after hosting a...

    "Forget about $5 natural gas. When can we get back to $3," asks Raymond James after hosting a conference in which the consensus sees only weak prices for the next 12 to 24 months. Prices are off again today, touching a multi-year low as forecasts for unseasonably warm temperatures continue. UNG -2.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • CEYHF

    Solar stocks take a beating after Conergy (OTC:CEYHF) CEO Philip Comberg warns the solar...

    Solar stocks take a beating after Conergy (OTC:CEYHF) CEO Philip Comberg warns the solar industry could be headed for a price war as demand sags and firms try to maintain market share. The interview in Germany's Handelsblatt effectively says pricing is falling below production costs. FSLR -6%, SPWR -5.8%, STP -4.6%, YGE -4.4%, TSL -3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • ANTH

    Citigroup piles on to Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH -40.3%), downgrading the shares to...

    Citigroup piles on to Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH -40.3%), downgrading the shares to Neutral and drastically lowering its price target to $3 from $11 after the company halted its VISTA-16 clinical study due to a lack efficacy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • EFX

    Equifax (EFX +3.7%) is upgraded by SunTrust, which says the transaction processing company is...

    Equifax (EFX +3.7%) is upgraded by SunTrust, which says the transaction processing company is poised to deliver sustainable above-average organic revenue and EPS growth thanks to rising analytics intensity in the underwriting process, the emergence of international credit markets, and as employers increasingly outsource income and employment verification.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • BCO

    Brink's (BCO -1.1%) trades lower after S&P cut its outlook on the company to negative from...

    Brink's (BCO -1.1%) trades lower after S&P cut its outlook on the company to negative from stable, citing the recent deterioration in credit metrics due to pressures from European and North American operations and unfunded retirement expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -3.4%) takes a hit after reporting that an employee of its Kingston...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -3.4%) takes a hit after reporting that an employee of its Kingston Mining unit suffered fatal injuries Saturday evening while working in a West Virginia coal mine. The coal producer has been under intense scrutiny in the wake of its purchase of Massey Energy, which owned the ill-fated Upper Big Branch mine where an explosion killed 29 miners two years ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • COG

    Oil stocks take a hit after China reported a trade deficit over the weekend, raising concerns...

    Oil stocks take a hit after China reported a trade deficit over the weekend, raising concerns about economic growth in the world's second-largest oil consuming nation: Cabot Oil & Gas (COG -3.3%), Murphy Oil (MUR -3.2%) and Baker Hughes (BHI -2.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • CEG

    Constellation Energy (CEG +2.8%) says it will pay $245M to settle FERC claims related to certain...

    Constellation Energy (CEG +2.8%) says it will pay $245M to settle FERC claims related to certain energy-trading transactions in New York wholesale energy markets. Shares in the company will cease trading tomorrow following the company's merger with Exelon (EXC +2.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL +13.7%) CEO Chip Bottone divulges more details on the firm's partnership...

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL +13.7%) CEO Chip Bottone divulges more details on the firm's partnership with POSCO in an earnings CC. In exchange for paying a onetime licensing fee, POSCO will have manufacturing rights and pay out ongoing royalties for each power plants that is completed. He also says that the equity investment from POSCO that has kickstarted FCEL's share price for the day will help bolster the firm's balance sheet.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • FB

    The Firsthand Technology Value Fund (SVVC +5.1%) sees its value jump after announcing it has...

    The Firsthand Technology Value Fund (SVVC +5.1%) sees its value jump after announcing it has bought an additional 330K Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) shares, more than doubling its stake to 530K shares ahead of the company's IPO. Firsthand's stake is worth $21.2M, or roughly 1/4 of the fund's trading value, based on the $40 price assigned to Facebook shares in a recent SharesPost auction.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • VC

    Visteon (VC -1%) dips after agreeing to sell its automotive lighting business for $92M in cash,...

    Visteon (VC -1%) dips after agreeing to sell its automotive lighting business for $92M in cash, as part of the auto-parts maker's ongoing effort to focus on core businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • TDW

    Tidewater (TDW -5.1%) trades lower after disclosing that it may have to pay an undetermined...

    Tidewater (TDW -5.1%) trades lower after disclosing that it may have to pay an undetermined amount of costs to relocate oil rigs from Angola to other markets after talks on an extension of a partnership with state-run Sonangol stall.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • UNTD

    United Online (UNTD -1.3%) dips after saying its Chief Strategy Officer Frederic Randall plans...

    United Online (UNTD -1.3%) dips after saying its Chief Strategy Officer Frederic Randall plans to resign March 16.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • CROX

    After meeting with Crocs' (CROX +1%) CFO, Stifel Nicolaus says it's more confident in the...

    After meeting with Crocs' (CROX +1%) CFO, Stifel Nicolaus says it's more confident in the company's H2 growth prospects. The firm expects the company to report higher than expected Q3 EPS partly due to its uptake of new products, and maintains its current Buy rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • RAIL

    Shares of FreightCar America (RAIL -6.1%) tilt lower after KeyBanc slaps the company with a...

    Shares of FreightCar America (RAIL -6.1%) tilt lower after KeyBanc slaps the company with a downgrade to Underweight from Hold along with lowered estimates for FY12 earnings. Looking ahead to next year, analysts see the company's coal car volume and revenue tailing off. It's been a bad day across the sector after an accident in China threw a spotlight on safety concerns. GBX -4.5%, ARII -7.9% on KeyBanc downgrade to Hold.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANTH

    Shares of Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH -52.1%) can't stop the freefall that was triggered...

    Shares of Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH -52.1%) can't stop the freefall that was triggered by Friday's announcement that it's canceling its late-stage trial of its experimental treatment for heart disease. Adam Feuerstein eyes the recent carnage with a number of biotech names to conclude that "fail" is now re-entering the lexicon of investors in the sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • FSL

    RBC's upgrade of Freescale Semiconductor (FSL -1.4%) is riddled with so many negatives, it's...

    RBC's upgrade of Freescale Semiconductor (FSL -1.4%) is riddled with so many negatives, it's little wonder shares are lower. FQ1 results (in April), long-term revenue growth and gross margins likely will come up short, the firm says. But FSL should de-leverage its massive debt pile in coming years, which would decrease the rate on its remaining debt, boosting EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • NES

    Heckmann (HEK -4.7%) trades down on a Wedbush downgrade to Underperform on the back of last...

    Heckmann (HEK -4.7%) trades down on a Wedbush downgrade to Underperform on the back of last weeks disappointing Q4 results, noting the company's core business of water management is substantially underperforming estimates. The firm also lowers its price target to $4 from $5.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -1.5%) adds to Friday's Starbucks-induced losses after Dougherty...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -1.5%) adds to Friday's Starbucks-induced losses after Dougherty slashes its PT to $65, albeit while maintaining a Buy. The firm isn't sold on claims that Starbucks' Verismo brewer will be fully complementary to Green Mountain's Keurig and Vue. It also notes the Verisma will directly compete with a brewer Green Mountain plans to introduce this holiday season in partnership with Lavazza.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • FGP

    Ferrellgas (FGP -6.7%) dips after being downgraded to Underperform at Wells Fargo, citing risk...

    Ferrellgas (FGP -6.7%) dips after being downgraded to Underperform at Wells Fargo, citing risk to the company's current level of distribution payment. The firm also lowers its price target range to $11 - $13 from $16 - $18.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU -1.5%) sells off a bit following Youku.com's (YOKU +13.7%) and Tudou's (TUDO +147%)...

    Baidu (BIDU -1.5%) sells off a bit following Youku.com's (YOKU +13.7%) and Tudou's (TUDO +147%) merger announcement. There could be fears the combined company, which will have a YouTube-like dominance of the Chinese online video market, will thwart Baidu's own online video ambitions.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • BORN

    China New Borun (BORN -6.9%) trades lower after Oppenheimer cut the shares to Perform, saying...

    China New Borun (BORN -6.9%) trades lower after Oppenheimer cut the shares to Perform, saying its gross margin has been shrinking for five consecutive quarters to a historically low 15.8%. The firm sees margin pressure continuing in 2012 due to high corn prices and intense competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • APPCQ

    American Apparel (APP +6.3%) rises on a NY Post report that George Soros is taking a hard...

    American Apparel (APP +6.3%) rises on a NY Post report that George Soros is taking a hard look at the retailer which has seen its shares decimated from levels above $15 in 2007 to ~$0.80 now. Crystal Financial, which boasts Soros’ hedge fund as its lead investor, is in talks to replace and expand a $75M revolving credit line from BofA that matures in July.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • ROK

    Rockwell Automation (ROK +1.5%) gains on positive comments out of Wells Fargo this morning,...

    Rockwell Automation (ROK +1.5%) gains on positive comments out of Wells Fargo this morning, saying recent channel checks have apparently yielded the best results in a year, and the company is poised to beat EPS consensus estimates for both Q2 and FY12.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • HOG

    Harley-Davidson (HOG +2.6%) shares hit a 52-week high after Citigroup raises its price target on...

    Harley-Davidson (HOG +2.6%) shares hit a 52-week high after Citigroup raises its price target on the motorcycle maker to $50 from $46, citing solid sales momentum. The firm’s dealer checks indicate HOG’s U.S. retail sales are up 16%-18% January through early March, but keeps its Hold rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • ORCL

    Oracle (ORCL -2.4%) sells off on a downgrade to Hold from Jefferies. The firm says its checks...

    Oracle (ORCL -2.4%) sells off on a downgrade to Hold from Jefferies. The firm says its checks indicate demand for high-end "engineered" systems such as Exadata and Exalogic is softening, and both the company's database sales and lucrative maintenance contracts are threatened by cloud software vendors. Oracle has been counting on sales of high-end systems to spur a turnaround for its slumping hardware business.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • GSK

    Shares of Human Genome Sciences (HGSI -7.1%) slide lower, extending a month-long losing streak...

    Shares of Human Genome Sciences (HGSI -7.1%) slide lower, extending a month-long losing streak that has seen HGSI's value diminish by over 20%. The negative sentiment has been driven in part by the fading belief that Glaxo SmithKline will make a run at buying the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • VXX

    After a quick move higher on Tuesday's sell off, the VIX (VXX -2.6%) dives to its lowest level...

    After a quick move higher on Tuesday's sell off, the VIX (VXX -2.6%) dives to its lowest level in a year, as calm (complacency?) reigns. John Spence notes investors cancelling insurance policies for market pullbacks by pulling cash from volatility-linked ETFs
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 2 Comments
  • TVIAQ

    Shares of Solazyme (SZYM +6.4%) perk up after the company gets a positive mention from Jim...

    Shares of Solazyme (SZYM +6.4%) perk up after the company gets a positive mention from Jim Cramer on Mad Money. The company’s game plan of transforming a range of plant-based sugars into oils has drawn increasing interest as oil prices linger at high levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL +4.1%) picks up steam after beating the earnings estimate of analysts by a...

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL +4.1%) picks up steam after beating the earnings estimate of analysts by a penny with its FQ1 report and announcing the expansion of a partnership with POSCO Energy that includes the purchase of 20M shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • VELTF

    Mobile ad agency Velti (VELT +11%) soars after blowing past Q4 estimates and issuing strong...

    Mobile ad agency Velti (VELT +11%) soars after blowing past Q4 estimates and issuing strong guidance. Velti, which has been dogged by concerns about its heavy European exposure, says it expects Q1 revenue of $44M-$48M ($45M consensus) and 2012 revenue of $280M-$295M ($281M consensus). Adjusted EBITDA is expected to reach $80M-$88M in 2012, up from 2011's $53.1M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • PHM

    Barclays upgrades home builders Pulte (PHM +1.7%), KBH (KBH +1.6%), Armstrong (AWI +2.9%) and...

    Barclays upgrades home builders Pulte (PHM +1.7%), KBH (KBH +1.6%), Armstrong (AWI +2.9%) and Mohawk (MHK +1.9%) to Overweight, citing a strong start to spring selling season and improving data from builders and building products while their stocks have "underperformed." Huh? Home builders have been red-hot; XHB +65% since Oct. 3. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • ATRS

    Shares of Antares Pharma (AIS -7.1%) trade lower after the firm's Q4 report underwhelms...

    Shares of Antares Pharma (AIS -7.1%) trade lower after the firm's Q4 report underwhelms investors as it shows the biotech firm is not yet turning a profit and expects to increase R&D spending by over 20% in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • HSY

    Hershey (HSY +1.5%) is raised to Buy at Goldman Sachs, which says it "benefits from portfolio...

    Hershey (HSY +1.5%) is raised to Buy at Goldman Sachs, which says it "benefits from portfolio resilience at home and strong momentum abroad... one of the few [packaged food companies] that can maintain organic sales growth momentum and beat earnings expectations." General Mills (GIS -0.3%) and Smuckers (SJM -0.6%) are cut to Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • SODA

    Oppenheimer's Joseph Altobello weighs in on SodaStream (SODA +5.7%) with a maintained Outperform...

    Oppenheimer's Joseph Altobello weighs in on SodaStream (SODA +5.7%) with a maintained Outperform rating and $55 price target after getting bowled over in a meeting with management. He says that he's buying in to the firm's contention that the slowdown in Q4 shipments understates the overall health of its business.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • OCRX

    Tranzyme Pharma (TZYM -65.9%) says a Phase 3 trial of its treatment to speed up gastrointestinal...

    Tranzyme Pharma (TZYM -65.9%) says a Phase 3 trial of its treatment to speed up gastrointestinal recovery following abdominal surgery failed to meet its primary endpoint. TZYM, which had planned to test ulimorelin in several additional indications, says it will stop all other activities related to the filing of a new drug application.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • FDML

    In addition to a new CEO, Federal-Mogul (NASDAQ:FDML) also says that it will create a new...

    In addition to a new CEO, Federal-Mogul (NASDAQ:FDML) also says that it will create a new Aftermarkets division after the business unit generated $2.3B in sales of branded automotive parts. The company has engaged a search firm to fill the position of CEO of the Aftermarket division.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • SINA

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) +4% after claiming 60% of Weibo's 250M+ users will register their real names...

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) +4% after claiming 60% of Weibo's 250M+ users will register their real names ahead of the Chinese government's Friday deadline to do so. Sina has rallied sharply in the last 2 weeks on hopes that the impact of new Weibo regulations won't be as bad as once feared.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • YOKU

    Chinese internet companies are on the move following news of the merger agreement between Youku...

    Chinese internet companies are on the move following news of the merger agreement between Youku (NYSE:YOKU) and Todou (NASDAQ:TUDO): RENN +8.7%, DANG +6.6% SOHU +4.3%, SINA +4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • FDML

    Federal-Mogul (NASDAQ:FDML) announces that CEO Jose Maria Alapont will retire on March 31 to be...

    Federal-Mogul (NASDAQ:FDML) announces that CEO Jose Maria Alapont will retire on March 31 to be replaced by current Senior VP Rainer Jueckstock who will also join the company's board. Shares +4.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • TUDO

    Premarket gainers: TUDO +203%. KUTV +33%. ZOLL +24%. YOKU +20%. OREX +15%. FCEL +9%. RENN +9%....

    Premarket gainers: TUDO +203%. KUTV +33%. ZOLL +24%. YOKU +20%. OREX +15%. FCEL +9%. RENN +9%. DANG +8%. SINA +4%.
    Losers: OTC:ANTH -51%. HGSI -4%. TLK -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • CCL

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL) +2% premarket after lowering its 2012 earnings forecast but pointing to...

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL) +2% premarket after lowering its 2012 earnings forecast but pointing to reassuring booking trends. Executives on a conference call Friday said the Concordia incident is no longer the main obstacle to selling cruises; instead, it is travelers' expectations that prices will fall in the wake of the disaster. Shares are upgraded to Outperform at Exane BNP Paribas.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM
  • CDTI

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI) +48.2% premarket after reporting Q4 EPS of $0.06, including...

    Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI) +48.2% premarket after reporting Q4 EPS of $0.06, including items, which may not compare to the analyst consensus $0.05 loss. Revenues rose 81% Y/Y to $21.3M vs. $18.5M expected. Income from operations totaled $200K vs. $3.9M loss from operations in the year-ago period.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • TUDO

    Tudou Holdings (NASDAQ:TUDO) +117.8% premarket after the merger announcement with Youku.com...

    Tudou Holdings (NASDAQ:TUDO) +117.8% premarket after the merger announcement with Youku.com (NYSE:YOKU), -6.1% permarket.
